resources.string: Tjong A Fie House is a two-storey house on Jalan Ahmad Yani in Kesawan, Medan, North Sumatra, built by Tjong A Fie (1860-1921), a Hakka merchant who owned many plantation lands in Medan. However, since 2009 parts of the house have been open for public visits. The house was completed in 1900 and designed with Chinese, European, Malay and art-deco architectural styles and became a historical tourist attraction in Medan. In this house, visitors can learn about the history of Tjong A Fie\'s life through photographs, paintings and furniture used by his family. furniture used by his family and learn about Malay-Chinese culture. Tjong A Fie was related to Cheong Fatt Tze who built Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion in Penang, Malaysia. At first glance, there are similarities between Tjong A Fie House and Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion. This museum has been included in one of the cultural heritage protected by the Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia. Therefore, there are many sources of information on the history and culture of the Chinese population in Medan, North Sumatra.
